message.entry:
Some coding rule violations have not been loaded.
The results contain {0} violations, but the limit is {1}.

To reduce the number of violations, use a coding rules subset or set the "Files and folders to ignore" option to "all-headers".
To change the limit, go to Tools > Preferences. On the Miscellaneous tab, change the "Coding rule violation limit" value.

message.entry: There is no suggestion for this path

Your justifications for this source file will be lost if the file is not analyzed in the next Polyspace verification.

To avoid this loss, annotate the code with your justifications:
  1. After you have entered information in the Results List pane, right-click the justified check.
  2. From the context menu, select Add Pre-Justification to Clipboard.
  3. In your source code, on the line before the check, paste the clipboard text.
  4. Save the file.
Show only new results found since the last analysis

No new results found since the last analysis.

Clear the 'New results' box to show all results (Total: {0}).

New results detection not activated.

To activate this feature in the Polyspace UI:
1. Select Tools > Preferences.
2. Select the Project and Results Folder tab.
3. Select option to automatically import comments from last verification.

To activate this feature from the command line:
Use the option '-import-comments results_folder' where results_folder contains previously generated results.

Clear the 'New results' box to close this message.

entry.note: analysis results, for the new Polyspace Desktop UI

message.entry:
This filtered view shows results that are new in this run compared to results information that you import from a previous run. To enable the import:
  • In the Polyspace Desktop UI, click Import Comments in the toolstrip.
  • At the command line, use option -import-comments oldResultsFolder where oldResultsFolder is the path of the folder where you store the previous results.
To close this message, remove the New filter.

entry.note: analysis results in diff mode vs baseline run

message.entry: Showing {0} out of {1} possible results (including {2} Fixed in Baseline)

entry.note: analysis results in diff mode vs previous run

message.entry: Showing {0} out of {1} possible results (including {2} Fixed in previous run)

The number of results shown in the results list after applying
review scopes or filtering compared to the total number of results.

Selected review scope: {0}

Review scopes are used to filter the results list and configure code metrics thresholds.
To create your own review scopes, select Tools->Preferences->Review Scope.

Selected review scope: {0}

Review scopes are used to filter the results list and configure code metrics thresholds.
To create your own review scopes, select Polyspace->Configure Project, then, Tools->Preferences->Review Scope.
Run-time checks - Shows run-time checks only.
Defects & Rules - Shows defects and coding rule results.
All results - All results are available.
HIS - For complying with Hersteller Initiative Software (HIS) standard. Shows code metrics that violate the HIS threshold.
Checks & Rules - Shows run-time checks and coding rule results.
Critical checks - Shows red, gray, and critical orange checks.
SQO-4 - Shows results that violate the Software Quality Objective Level 4 (SQO-4) threshold.
SQO-5 - Shows results that violate the Software Quality Objective Level 5 (SQO-5) threshold.
SQO-6 - Shows results that violate the Software Quality Objective Level 6 (SQO-6) threshold.
{0} - Shows results selected in the review scope preferences.

message.entry:
Some orange checks caused by this source are filtered from Results List.
To see all checks, select 'All results' in the Results List dropdown and unselect 'New' button.

The metrics provide:
  • Measure of the percentage of code checked for run-time errors.
  • Indication of the validity of the configuration.

Low percentages for functions or code operations may indicate an early red check or missing function call.
Possible reasons for low values:
  • Program entry points are not provided in the Polyspace configuration.
  • Variable or function ranges are not specified.

Search Reasons For Unchecked Code in the documentation.

The metrics provide:
  • Measure of the percentage of code checked for run-time errors.
  • Indication of the validity of the configuration.

Low percentages for procedures or code operations may indicate an early red check or missing function call.
Possible reasons for low values:
  • Program entry points are not provided in the Polyspace configuration.
  • Variable or function ranges are not specified.

Search Reasons For Unchecked Code in the documentation.

message.entry: Polyspace stubbed this function.\nTo analyze the function body, remove the function name from the -functions-to-stub option.

This function is an Embedded Coder Lookup-Table function.\nPolyspace stubbed this function to increase precision.\nTo analyze the function body, unset the -stub-embedded-coder-lookup-table-functions option.

The function body is not analyzed because Polyspace uses a stub to improve accuracy.\nTo force analysis, disable the dedicated checker, remove the -library option,\nor remove this function from the XML file of -code-behavior-specifications.
The function body is not analyzed because Polyspace uses a stub to improve accuracy.\nTo force analysis, remove the -library stdlibcxx option.
The function body is not analyzed because of compilation error(s).

Function stubbed because of -classification specification.\nTo analyze this function, add the function to the <analyze-functions> element\nor remove the function from the <do-not-analyze-functions> element of the classification XML file.
Function from standard library: Polyspace uses a stub to improve accuracy.

This view is relevant for projects set up from AUTOSAR-specific code.
If you select an AUTOSAR-specific check and click links in the details, the view shows the corresponding AUTOSAR behavior specification.

Connection with Polyspace Desktop App has failed.


NOTE: This feature is not available in the Polyspace Platform user interface. If you are using Polyspace Platform, switch back to the old Polyspace UI to use this feature.


On the Desktop App, select Tools -> Preferences:

  • Select the Server Configuration tab,
  • Check the 'Polyspace Access web interface configuration',
  • Click 'Register Polyspace UI'.

Connection with Polyspace Desktop App has failed. Start the desktop app before clicking 'Open Desktop App'.


NOTE: This feature is not available in the Polyspace Platform user interface. If you are using Polyspace Platform, switch back to the old Polyspace UI to use this feature.


If the desktop app is already started:

  • Select Tools -> Preferences,
  • Select the Server Configuration tab,
  • Check the 'Polyspace Access web interface configuration.'
